column1: The '''Westfarthing''' was one of the four [[Farthings]] of [[the Shire]]. Its easternmost point was the [[Three-Farthing Stone]]<ref name="Part">{{FR
column2: Part}}</ref> and on its western border were the [[Far Downs]]<ref>{{FR
column4: 31}} on, the region of [[Westmarch]]). Within its bounds was the "capital" of the Shire, [[Michel Delving]] and the ancestral homeland of the [[Took Family
column5: Tooks]] (and thus the seat of the [[Thain]]), known as [[Tookland]].<ref>{{FR
column6: I3}}</ref> Also, in the Westfarthing was [[Hobbiton]], the home of [[Bilbo Baggins]] and his nephew, [[Frodo Baggins]].<ref name="Part"/>

column1: A considerable portion of this farthing was included on the map called [[A Part of the Shire]] so many features of this section were shown:
*Hills: A portion of the [[Green Hill Country]], [[Hobbiton Hill]], [[White Downs]], [[Far Downs]]
*Rivers: [[The Water]], possibly a portion of the [[Norbourn]]
Perhaps the most significant event regarding Westfarthing was when [[Isumbras Took I]] became a [[Thain]] in {{TA
column2: 2340}}, beginning the hereditary Thainship of the Took line.<ref name=order/> Thus Westfarthing was the centre of Hobbit "authority".
2941}}, the Unexpected Party occurred in the home of [[Bilbo Baggins]] at [[Bag End]]<ref name="third">{{App
column3: TA}}</ref> in the West Farthing, and from the ''[[Green Dragon]]'' in [[Bywater]], the [[Quest of Erebor]] began.<ref>{{H
column4: Mutton}}</ref> When Bilbo returned the next year he had to deal with an auction of his belongings since he had been presumed dead.<ref>{{H

column1: Upon their return from their adventures in the south, Frodo, Sam, Pippin, and [[Meriadoc Brandybuck
column2: Merry]] returned to the Shire and in the Westfarthing they were the leaders in the [[Battle of Bywater]], on [[1 November]] {{TA

column1: Every seven years the [[Mayor of Michel Delving]] was elected at the [[Free Fair]] on the [[White Downs]] at [[Lithe]].<ref name=order>{{FR

As Westfarthing was the centre of Hobbit authority, the dialect of the Westfarthing (in scattered parts) had retained the deferential pronoun of the proper [[Westron]] which was lost in other forms of [[Hobbitish]] language. It was used more as a light-hearted term of endearment.<ref>{{App
